跟一代比起來加入了許多新的元素，但又不失這款遊戲的本質，非常推薦。
在單機模式中，故事劇情可以說是完美，有些時候的解謎又不能慢慢思考，需要快速地做出決定，非常有趣。
在雙人模式中，可以體驗跟朋友一起動腦的娛樂，當然這個娛樂也不僅是在動腦方面，可能是翻覆友誼的小船。
建議可以在玩完一代的單人模式後，再來遊玩二代的單人模式，這樣劇情比較有連貫性，也可以更投入在劇情中。

Nach Teil 1 kommt Teil 2 und diesmal mit 15 mal mehr Spielzeit! Portal 1 (als eigentliche Demo) geht ja nur 1 Stunde, Portal 2 hingegen als vorgesehenes Spiel ganze 15 Stunden. Dabei überzeugt das Spiel mal wieder mit guten Puzzle-Elementen und einer einzigartigen genialen Story! Der Humor ist mal wieder typisch Portal! Schwarzer Humor mal anders! Die Story ist diesmal auch sehr packend. Das Spiel wird auch durch neue Spielelemente stark aufgewertet, welche das sind sag ich mal nicht ;)
Das Spiel ist oft im Sale für 0,99 Euro und das loht sich alle mal! Habe das Spiel schon 3 mal durchgespielt.
Nachdem man das Spiel durch hat sollte man auch die kostenlosen Mods ,,Portal Stories: Mel" (im Prinzip Portal 3) und ,,Portal Reloaded" (im Prinzip Portal 4 + sehr fordernd!).

Portal and Portal 2 are the most innovative puzzle games of their time. Portal 2 is an extension of the brilliant design and potential that the original offered, with new mechanics, graphical improvements, and a new, very charming singleplayer story, with very charming characters.

Portal's gameplay revolves around the properties of two "portals" which players can shoot onto specific types of walls. Players can enter through one portal and seamlessly emerge through the other in addition to being able to see directly through them to the other side. Momentum is preserved when traversing through portals, which allows players to gain thrilling levels of velocity while basically playing with space.

Though the player controller's normal walking speed is painfully slow, players can take advantage of various movement techniques to speed themselves up during gameplay. Once you learn how to air-strafe and bunnyhop, the rest becomes increasingly easier to master. Movement techniques enhance the experience.

The game offers a fantastic singleplayer experience with lovable characters and hilariously witty dialogue. Its replay value is immense for someone like me who enjoys experiencing the game world. There's also a two-player cooperative course, full of chambers to complete. On top of all that exists the Perpetual Testing Initiative, or Community Test Chambers. Community members can create and publish their own test chambers for others to enjoy, and there are a lot of geniuses who play this game. You'll virtually never run out of content.

All in all, this is one of my favorite video games of all time. It's incredibly clever in concept and in execution. Though I will close Portal 2 for the last time someday, that day will be very near to the day I die.

Portal 2 is a good game. The puzzles are interesting and satisfying when completed, the story is great, and the community-made levels add an endless amount of quality levels. I recommend Portal 2 for these reasons.

真的是过于好玩，甚至结束的那一刻，除了终于从地下室中解脱的快乐更有些不舍，GlaDOs逐渐找回自己的记忆那一部分也十分的动人，Wheatley也还是挺可爱的，单人模式剧情十分紧凑，7章以后在工厂里面真的能够体会到光圈实验室一步步从繁华走向破败，志愿者从刚开始的优秀人才再到最后连流浪汉都无法招募只能使用工作人员，都掀开了研究成果背后血淋淋的牺牲，虽然是个解密游戏，不时穿插的剧情却让人觉得有些沉重，也会给人留下思考，真的十分优秀的作品，有被感动到，双人模式我觉得比单人模式要难上许多，很看配合，不过协作部分做的很好

Portal 2 is easily one of my favourite games, it has some amazing mechanics (which expanded on the first instalment of the series) which Valve cleverly designed the puzzles around. I found that the game had the perfect balance of difficulty with me having to scratch my head at times but never getting frustrated and shutting the game off.

But how could I write about Portal 2 and not mention the amazing story? I absolutely love it! It continues quite a bit of time after the first game and is extremely captivating. You explore the history of Aperture Science and learn more about the creation of GLaDOS. Talking about GLaDOS, I love her dry humour. This game's sense of comedy really adds to your entertainment.

This game was released in 2011, and still looks STUNNING for its age, I remember I was shocked in the first scene with Chell's room crumbling as Wheatly (quite poorly) manoeuvred it that the Source engine could do something like that! Being a Source game, not only does it look amazing, but can run on pretty much anything - there isn't a reason to not play it!

I would recommend playing the first game first however, while the story isn't [i] as [/i] central and it doesn't look [i] as [/i] good as Portal 2 (not that it looks bad), it is a great intro to the mechanics, gives quite a bit of back story to the game and it still has GLaDOS's amazing humor!

Overall, this game is timeless and I can recommend it to absolutely anyone. Especially for those who want a good puzzle or are used to shooters but want something a bit different (the portal gun is the perfect device for that).

Portal 2 is the best puzzle game I have played. The portal gun is incredibly fun to use and has enough of a skill ceiling that you could play through the game several times while learning new things you can do with portals each time. The puzzles were always engaging and offer a decent amount of challenge on your first play through and on additional plays you can attempt usually difficult portal placements or sequences to bypass some of the puzzles. I have played the co-op campaign with three different people and enjoyed it each time, if the game was made by a different developer anytime in the last 6-8 years the co-op would have likely been a dlc but it is just part of the game, for 10 dollars and frequent 75% off sales it is one of the best purchases you can make on Steam.

Even after all these years, knowing the solution to all the puzzles, and hearing the same story and jokes again and again. Portal 2 is not really a game to me anymore, but like a trip down memory lane. A walking trail I can describe every step of but I still walk down for nothing more than the experience.

What a precious thing to have.
